node.title: Former Army Officer Who Wrote John McCain About Prisoner Abuse by US Soldiers Dies
node.description: "...I have been unable to get clear, consistent answers from my leadership about what constitutes lawful and humane treatment of detainees," Ian Fishback wrote.

node.title: Activists charged after 12-hour protest against Woodside gas project
node.description: Police say the demonstration against the $16 billion Scarborough project endangered the public and drained their resources.

node.title: Review of ballistics evidence ordered 25 years after Jeffery Brooks was shot dead
node.description: NSW Police will review ballistics evidence more than 25 years after the 24-year-old was shot dead on a farm south of Brisbane, as an inquest investigates who pulled the trigger.

node.title: 'I'm sure there will be controversy': World Rugby opens the door for Israel Folau to switch to Tonga
node.description: Sacked Wallaby Israel Folau could make the switch to Tonga after World Rugby changed its eligibility requirements, with head coach Toutai Kefu saying the pair have spoken about it.

node.title: Abused as a child, Lula wants her trauma recognised in the same way it is for soldiers and first responders
node.description: Victim survivors and women's advocacy groups launch a campaign to have trauma from gender-based violence recognised as an injury so that they have access to better care.

node.title: This community has the highest rate of DV offences in SA, and now its people are saying enough
node.description: The remote South Australian town of Coober Pedy is best known for the opals mined underground, but scratch beneath the surface and there is a far more heartbreaking claim to fame — with abuse affecting more than one in 10 residents.

node.title: How a video of Ahmaud Arbery's death captured the world's attention and led to three murder convictions
node.description: Greg McMichael, his son Travis McMichael and neighbour William "Roddie" Bryan were not charged until a video of the incident emerged, two months after Ahmaud Arbery's murder in 2020.

node.title: BOM summer outlook: It will pay to check for floods before setting out this summer
node.description: Thanks to the La Niña, finally announced on Tuesday, conditions are expected to be wetter than average for parts of the east coast this summer, according to the Bureau of Meteorology's official summer outlook.

node.title: 'What a long time you have waited for this': Massive tract of Cape York land handed back to traditional owners
node.description: The first claims in one of Australia's largest native title applications has been granted on Cape York, the culmination of the "hard work and determination of a lot of people".

node.title: Beating the lights? Scrutiny still possible despite messy legislative rush - expert
node.description: Government excuses over the rushed process for the traffic lights law do not stack up, but there will be a chance to scrutinise health orders made under it, experts say. Audio

node.title: Many migrants heading for UK die after boat sinks
node.description: At least 27 migrants headed for the UK have drowned in the English Channel near Calais after their boat sank.
